reviews.sentence: Great all around hotel. I was reticent to stay due to some of the reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised by the special property. Personnel were all friendly and efficient. The facility was clean had a Starbucks in the lobby and an excellent bar restaurant just off the lobby. Room was clean well equipped. Bathroom was large and the shower drain actually worked. AC was easy to control and had to deal with warm daytime and cool night time temps. After a three day stay I felt quite at home and would recommend this hotel for business vacation or family needs. The views are spectacular it is 30 minutes from Denver Airport has a 24 movie theater and shopping within walking distance. What more could you wantPhil.

Combines Health with Travel. You know how you tend to eat badly exercise less and overall slack off on your health regime when you travel. The Westin Westminster offers a running concierge for daily 3mile group runs running maps a nicely equipped gym indoor pool albeit small and even lends you New Balance shoes socks and workout clothes which are delivered to your room for 5. There went my excuse for not exercising. They also offer heart healthy menus of nutritious foods juices and smoothies. The location of this Westin is pretty good right off 36 about halfway between Denver Boulder about 40 mins depending on traffic from airport. It also has a footbridge to the Promenade across the street which has a selection of restaurants comedy club and AMC movie theatre. For those of you with kids check out the Butterfly Pavilion down the block. Other pointsPet friendly Starbucks in lobby Excellent Southwestern NM restaurant Kachina on premises Free parking unles valeted but lot fills up quickly Westin brand mattress and bedding available to buyOnly two negatives 1. Rooms could be updated including plumbing. I should not be awakened in the middle of the night when the room next to me flushes their toilet. 2. Check in was a long line that went the length of the lobby and only two hotel employees handling. This should have been anticipated based on event reservations and appropriate staffing scheduled.
Great. Excellent bed and room. Good location.

Views from window on 9th floor on mountain side are excellent. Staff attitude and effectiveness on a par with star rating. 50 discounted price made this stay an OK value. Slow service from restaurant twice errors in pricing on room service order fixed by manager food in room not hot enough and bad milk for coffee. The hotel feels somewhat dated and ready for an update.

can not say enough about this place. What a beautiful place. Spotless. Perfect location with a view of the mountains. surrounded by so many restaurants and shopping I truly enjoyed my stay here. Check in was a breeze friendly employees pool fitness room and hot tub were top notch. Free self parking just a few yards away with plenty of parking spots. there is a charge for wi fibeats me why. so I used my Verizon mi fi insteadcal me cheap. I even tried getting it for free as an SPG member but that did not work. I was on the 10th floor and I enjoyed waking up to the beautiful mountain view. My wife does not like travelling because the hotels are never clean enough but she gave this place an A which says a lot. I will surely stay here again.

The Westin Westminster. Great location with restaurant in walking distance. Clean with all the nice touches of a Westin hotel. Staff very accommodating to our needs. The look and the style of the hotel are fitting for the Calarado area.

The Westin walk to the Westminster promenade. The Westin Westminster is a beautiful property and with the Westminster promenade within walking distance it is a great choice for families wanting a one stop experience in North Denver as long as they do not mind a postage stamp size room. All things considered it is a great stay.

Excellent experience. They upgraded our room for free. There was 24 hour room service. Late check out was as late as we wanted just 10 per hour after 1 pm. The bed was amazing. We had a corner room and the view was beautiful. We will definitely be staying here again.
Denver visit. very clean rooms comfortable bed and friendly staff. close to every place we wanted to be.

Okay but not great. We got a good deal on a nice hotel so decided to stay. But there are little things that both. For example Free Parking means parking across the street. Free Valet Parking sign is displayed outside but then inside it tells you it is 5 for the day or 15 overnight. Also it does not include breakfast nor wifi. Luckily all of the rooms have a good view.

I have to share this end to our trip which changed my point of view of the hotel and management. Our flight was cancelled due to weather and we noticed rooms available on hotelscom. The front desk Manager stated there were no rooms and that must be incorrect. I was going to reserve the room since it showed available which she called to someone and typed something down and the room was gone. The worst part is she did not direct us where to go in the local area having no hotel room and needing another night. We debated between the Mariot and ALoft which surprisingly is part of the Westin group. How difficult is it to turn away a customer as if oh well. No ok. And we still end up at your sister hotel. We could have easily gone to another hotel not knowing the area. Overall the Manager was not accommodating and did not even empathize or ask where we were heading. She soely focused on that the ap must be incorrect and not to book it since they did not have rooms. Terrible customer service.
Amazing stay. Amazing stay. Not only was it in a great location but the views were amazing and every one was so niceI will definitely be back with my family next time.

Loved the location. My daughter I stayed there because it was fairly close to a dance competition that we attended. It was nice to have restaurants shopping entertainment very close to the hotel. The hot tub jets have a mind of their own. Both days we were only given one clean wash cloth. A Starbucks cup was left on a table near the elevators for days. Free parking was nice. I believe that it should be free internet. I was not willing to pay 150 a day for it. Overall it was a nice hotel I would stay there again. Close to restaurants shopping entertainment. Dave Busters Butterfly Pavilion bowling movie theaters restaurants Target a variety of stores are very close. Free internet hot tub jets fixed do not be stingy with the washcloths pick up cups in common areas.

I was really surprised for the high caliper the Westin is that it did not have microwaves in the room free Wi Fi and free breakfast and happy hour for guests that was not comparable to lower priced hotels in the area otherwise beds very comfortable great view toward the west also hostess seem rude in restaurant inside by lobby because we did not have reservations seats were empty all around and gave us a very uncomfortable seat hostess did not come back for ten minutes very overpriced meals so we walked out and got great service and a better meal somewhere else for half the price listed hereat least hotel lobby person was very helpful.

Unhappy. Reserved a king room for which we prepaid knowing that it was non refundable. Upon arrival we were informed that all king rooms had been rented. After much discussion we were told we would be in a double bed room and would receive a small credit in the restaurant. It was a very unsatisfactory stay. We will not be staying at this hotel in the future.

Lovely but room service thumbs down. It was wonderful to visit the Westin. Beautiful property. Very clean and beds were so comfy. Friendly at the front desk. We ordered room service for evening. Good menu choice. Unfortunately they sent uncooked raw ranch fries they sent up a fresh order. Then we chose the breakfast card option hang on door before midnight chose delivery time and choose from a variety of options on the menu. they only made a few items and forgot to make for 4 people only brought meal for 1. But brought 4 drinks. Bummer. The room attendant was lovely apologized several times. Brought my kids lots of sodas to take to CU game. They were thrilled. Pool and hotub view amazing. Valet was pricey but for a Westin in the city spot on.

Nice hotel just do n’t book with expedia. Hotel was nice just never seem to get the room you book with expedia Clean quiet and comfortable rooms and the prairie dogs and rabbits everywhere were cool also Lots to do within an hour or so pikes peak and Estes Park and Rocky Mountain National Park. Make sure you get the room you book.

I can not believe in this day that they actually charge for everything that most cheaper alternatives give free access to. Wi Fi is a 10 dollar charge. Otherwise it had the prettiest views I lucked out and got a Mountain view room. I would never pay full price for this place though. It was nice but not that nice. I booked mine on the cheap through Hotwire. Glad I paid very little.
I would have given this hotel all 10s except the bathroom was very dirty.

Hotel room shuffle. First room we checked into had a leaky toilet and TV was n’t working. Maintenance was n’t able to fix right away and after complaining we were moved to another room which was fine however the inconvenience was annoying for sure. Maintenance folks were fixing floor just off the elevator which should have been done early in the morning however not in the middle of the day too much traffic. Overall it was a decent hotel I expected a bit more.

Great beds not so good service. I normally love to stay at westin hotels as the beds are very comfortable. On this point the Weston Westminster did not disappoint beds and pillows were very comfortable. However the bathroom was very outdated and we even have to call as oir toilet was nor working well. We also arrive one night and our room was not done so when we call the front desk they only say that we might have left the do not disturb sign which we did not do. What bothered me the most about the room situation is that it seems they did not care or feel really sorry for it as they treat it like it was not important. I was very surprised as I have always experienced great service at the Westin hotels. Overall expect the comfort from the Westins but the service of a lower quality hotel.

Love love love this hotel. Staff is over the top. Beds and linens are the best and we stay in many hotels. Rain shower in the bathroom is wonderful. Very quiet rooms. I was thinking of taking a hot tub but we went to the pool which was overrun with kids and found there was no hot tub after all. That ’s ok because I ’m sure the children would have taken it over. Saw a lot of dogs but did n’t hear them. My husband and I have allergies so we ’re always challenged trying to find hotels that do NOT allow pets. Still best hotel ever.

The lobby is nice the service was excellent. Everyone super nice and friendly. The reason for the average rating is because the room 1416 looked old dusty had a fly as we walked in but the cherry on top the mattress. It was so uncomfortable. We felt the springs and next morning we both woke up with backpain. Super disappointed with such a high end name hotel to provide guests with an uncomfortable bed. The bed is most important. Also want to add the toiletries were disappointing. walls are thin. You could hear he people next door and pl walking talking in the hallway.

I loved this hotel. Staff incredibly friendly shout out to Marcus Cruz. Bed and pillows phenomenal. I guess they redid bathrooms a few months ago. Shower to die for. Food was good. Next time in Denver a no brainer for me.

Paid in excess of 400 a night for the romPlumbing issues in the bathromTub faucet leaked and dripped all nightWhile taking a shower the tub filled with water that would not drain. Reported issue at checkout and promised by clerk I would hear from the managerNo response so far.
Very nice. Excellent service helpful staff and nice view. As a side note the hot water handle was very loose and the shower door was at an angle so it opened by itself periodically.
Dirty windows and noises from plumbing.
All was good except there was n’t any way to get breakfast in the room at 6 am. They said 24 hour room service but could n’t swing that. Weird.

My fiancé and I used this hotel for our wedding room block this past July. It is a beautiful hotel however the staff from top to bottom are horrendous. The first of the many issues we ran into was the lack of communication. We had wanted to book one of their 2 executive suites in the building over a year in advance. We decided to take a week to think about it. It was majorly disappointing that no one reached out to us because during that time they both became booked. But we understand and dealt with it. Another instance we encountered dealt with the lack of communication about how to give our guests the link to our block reservation. I had to go out of my way for months tracking staff down to get the correct information. Come to find out that during this time there was a huge turnover and our account never became formally transferred to anyone. You would think that whoever was in charge of room blocks for the hotel would reach out immediately to clients to let them know the change in staffing. However we understood that this things happens in big companies like this. Fast forward to this past May of 2019. I had contacted our point person to pass out our 9 welcome bags to our guests. She agreed and said she would put a note in our account. When our wedding week came around my mother in law dropped them off and was assured that they would be given out by the manager. A manager who gave her his card. When my husband and I checked in that Friday before our wedding I also verified that the bags had been given out. The desk rep went and checked and said that since he could n’t find any that they must have been handed out. It was the day before our wedding and I did not question him. I should have as not all our guests had arrived. But once again it was the day before our wedding. In the end 2 out of 9 bags were given out and these were only given because we told these guests to ask for them. These bags were well worth over 150 in total and took hours of time to put together. After finding out that this all happened I contacted another manager. He apologized and explained that he would work with those who were to blame to fix this mistake in the future. He also agreed to send us a gift certificate to make up for the hassle and money wasted from their carelessness. It has been almost a month and we have received nothing. I am not surprised at this point. From top to bottom the staff are absolutely terrible and I wish we would have used a different hotel for our wedding after our initial issues. Please save your money and go elsewhere.

It was a lovely site however the room had many concerns. it was not the one we selected which was OK but the first day our bathroom was cleaned but the rest of the room was not for example the bed was not even made. Next the TV remote control did not work it was as if the batteries were dying and we could not open the back to readjust them when we told the front desk they apologized but no TV other than the Mariot commercials for 3 days and last is the worst the toilet would not flush on the first try whereas the second would fill the bowl for about five minutes rendering it unusable for about five minutes then flush it would fill to the top leaving us in fear of an overflow again they apologized but it was a tough workaround with a schedule as we often were forced to the lobby restrooms to meet our ride schedules this is not an enjoyable way to get ready.
